V436 Per.why_exclude: unable to achieve good fit without jktebop overide of LD params
V436 Per.source: DEBCat and Southworth & Bowman (2022) Table 3. Tess sector 18 SAP data analysed with JKTEBOP. Teffs reproduced from Janik et al. (2003)
V436 Per.details: 2 short cadence sectors (18 & 85); eccentric orbit with eclipse depths of ~0.4 and ~0.15 mag; long period means only one of each eclipse is observed; Star B is both larger (k~1.1) and more luminous (J~1.04) than Star A; Southworth & Bowman found LC solutions where k=0.69(3), 0.84(2) and 1.10(3), with that last adopted;
V436 Per.notes: not in TESS-ebs so ephemeris (from SouthworthBowman22mnras) & morph defined here; jktebop_overrides of LD params are from source work & and are key to getting comperable fit; despite the long period using flattening leads to a worse fit; sector 85 is omitted as it has only one eclipse;

V539 Ara.source: DEBCat and Southworth & Bowman (2022) Table 3. Tess sectors 13 and 39 SAP data separately analysed with JKTEBOP (due to apsidal motion). Teffs reproduced from Clausen (1996).
V539 Ara.details: 4 short cadence sectors (13, 39, 66 & 93); eccentric orbit with eclipses of approximate depth 0.45 and 0.40 mag; apsidal motion results in significant phase shift for later sectors; primary fractional radius of 0.22 is beyond JKTEBOP's usually recommended maximum (0.2);
V539 Ara.notes: sectors 39, 66 & 93 omitted as jktebop throws gaussj errors on param 18 (phase shift?) - we could use errors to exclude these on retry; all sectors have pdc_tot=0 so cannot be used for selection; override teff_sys to more appropriate value for SpT;

MU Cas.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 22, Tables II & III. TESS sectors 17, 18, 24, 57, 58, 77 & 78 SAP photometry (120 s) analysed with JKTEBOP version 43. Refines characterisation of LacyClaret+04aj.
MU Cas.details: 9 short cadence sectors (17-18, 24, 57-58, 77-78 & 84-85); a pair of B5 V stars in a 9.65 d elliptical orbit; eclipses are approximately 0.45 and 0.44 mag deep with the secondary at phase ~0.62;
MU Cas.notes: distorted sections of S18 & 78 - both have low(est) pdc_tot so may be easily omitted; S77 has highest pdc_tot = 0.891; override teff_sys to more appropriate value for SpT; needs both stars' LD fixed at pow2/0.519/0.3811 to match the published light-curve fits; Southworth25obsR22 uses E(B-V)=0.44+/-0.05 mag and gives dist=1814+/-37 pc;

IQ Per.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 21 table IV. Initial JKTEBOP v43 anlysis of TESS sector 59 and full analysis of sectors 19 and 59 with WD2004 code.
IQ Per.details: 3 short cadence sectors (19, 59 & 86); totally eclipsing system with an eccentric orbit and apsidal motion; eclipses are ~0.45 and ~0.15 mag deep with the secondary appearing before phase 0.5; an additional challange is presented by the primary B-type star which is pulsating;
IQ Per.notes: early part of S86 is 'messy' and not clipping leads to a fit with iterations warning but one which is consistent with 19 & 59; all 3 sectors have pdc_tot=0 so cannot select/exclude based on this; Southworth24obsR21 uses E(B-V)=0.12+/-0.03 mag and gives dist=278.1+/-3.8 pc;

AR Aur.source: DEBCAT and Rediscussion 25 Table IV. SAP flux at a cadence of 120 s from TESS sectors 19, 43, 44, 45, 59, 71, 73 & 86 separately characterized with JKTEBOP.
AR Aur.details: 8 short cadence sectors (19, 43-45, 59, 71, 73 & 86); a pair of late-B stars in a circular 4.135 day orbit; primary and secondary partial eclipses of depth ~0.6 and ~0.55 mag;
AR Aur.notes: works well by taking the mean of the fits of each sector; Southworth25obsR25 uses E(B-V)=0.01+/-0.01 mag and gives dist=136.4+/-1.7 pc;

V1229 Tau.source: DEBCat and Southworth et al. (2023), Table I. TESS sectors 42-44 SAP flux analysed with JKTEBOP version 43. SpT originally from Abt & Levato (1978)
V1229 Tau.details: 5 short cadence sectors (42-44 & 70-71); an inclined, circular orbit with shallow primary (~0.10 mag) and secondary (~0.05 mag) partial eclipses, reflection and ellipsoidal effects;
V1229 Tau.notes: not in TESS-ebs so ephemeris & morph defined here; S44 (0.939) & S71 (0.547) have highest pdc_tot in each group of sectors; SouthworthMurphy+23mnrasl use an lrat (to mitigate shallow partial eclipses) and circular orbit in LC fit; SouthworthMurphy+23mnrasl give E(B-V)=0.04+/-0.01 mag & dist(K-band)=134.7+/-2.0 pc;

V889 Aql.source: DEBCAT and Baroch et al. (2022) Tables 9 and 10. Used SAP flux extracted from TESS sectors 14 and 40 FFIs analysed with JKTEBOP and all params published. TESS sector 40 & 54 600 s timeseries data now available.
V889 Aql.details: sectors 40 & 54 @ 600 s cadence and sector 80 @ 200 s; a highly eccentric orbit with the secondary eclipse at phase ~0.35; eclipse depths differ despite the stars having similar radii and brightness;
V889 Aql.notes: not in Tess-ebs so ephemeris & morph defined here; nothing at short/120 s cadence so chosing available sector(s) with highest cadence; useful test that code works at cadences > 120 s; published fit uses a lrat to mitigate k & J being near unity; better fit after quad detrending - not sure how to automate this choice so may default to quad for all;

V596 Pup.source: DEBCAT and Rediscussion 24 Table III. Used SAP flux from TESS sectors 34 and 61 separately characterized with JKTEBOP v43.
V596 Pup.details: 3 short cadence sectors (34, 61 & 88); eccentric 4.596 day orbit with the secondary eclipse near phase 0.475; eclipse depths of ~0.45 & ~0.40 mag; the published work found evidence of delta-Scut pulsations and apsidal motion; high fitted L3=0.2026+/-0.0010;
V596 Pup.notes: not in TESS-ebs so ephemeris & morph defined here; consistent fit across the 3 sectors; Southworth25obsR24 uses E(B-V)=0.07+/-0.02 and gives dist=178.4+/-2.5 pc;

WW Aur.source: DEBCat and Southworth et al. (2005) table 12. Uses EBOP (with mods to fit rA+rB & k and to use MRQMIN) for fitting of observations from the 1970s. We use V-band fitting results (Table 10).
WW Aur.details: 8 short cadence sectors (20, 43-45, 60 & 71-73); an inclined circular orbit showing partial eclipses of approximately 0.64 and 0.55 mag; secondary nr phase 0.5 yet noticable phase shift on later sectors; published work based on legacy photometry;

V788 Cen.source: DEBCat and Graczyk et al. (2022) (Table 8 & 9) who use WD for fitting SAP flux of 2nd half of sector 37 (as least affected by starspots), leaving sector 10 unused.
V788 Cen.details: 3 short cadence sectors (10, 37 & 64); an inclined circular orbit with partial eclipses of ~0.19 and ~0.16 mag;
V788 Cen.notes: S10 gives warnings and an incorrect fit; source characterisation excludes S10 and fixes L3=0.021; cannot use pdc_tot rules to exclude S10 as all have pdc_tot=0; fitting S37 has iteration warning but resulting fit is consistent with 64;

RR Lyn.why_exclude: Can only get a workable fit on S20 and there is currently no way that a pipeline could make an informed decision to exclude the other sectors (all pdc_tot=0).
RR Lyn.source: Rediscussion 7, Table III. TESS sector 20 SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 41.
RR Lyn.details: 3 short cadence sectors (20, 60 & 73); an eccentric orbit with eclipses of approximately 0.35 and 0.25 mag and the secondary near phase 0.45; significant phase shift on later sectors; evidence of delta-Scuti & gamma-Dor pulsations;
RR Lyn.notes: ebop maven testing uses flatten for best fit of S20; sticking with S20 until we can extend flattening; cannot use pdc_tot to select/exclude as all sectors are zero; will challenge an 'auto-flatten' algo as the phase shift is significant - a test with the params from the ebop maven data shows it doesn't transfer to S60 & 73 well; Southworth21obsR7 uses E(B-V)=0.002+/-0.002 mag and gives dist=76.7+/-1.0 pc;

V362 Pav.source: DEBCat and Graczyk et al. (2022) Table 9. They use WD for fitting of SAP fluxes of 2nd half of Sector 13.
V362 Pav.details: 2 short cadence sectors (13 & 66); an inclined slightly eccentric orbit with eclipses of ~0.2 and ~0.03 mag; secondary eclipse is shallow but total; clear ellipsoidal effect; star B is signifantly smaller, less luminous and less massive; published parameters include a significant negative third light value;

V456 Cyg.source: DEBCat and Van Reeth et al. (2022) Table 1. TESS sectors 14 and 15 fitted with JKTEBOP version 42. SpT and logLA from Bakis et al. (2014).
V456 Cyg.details: 4 short cadence sectors (14-15, 41 & 75); a tight circular orbit of just 0.9 d with deep eclipses of ~0.6 & ~0.4 mag; variability is seen in the light curve from pulsations dicussed in the source article;
V456 Cyg.notes: both fractional radii are > 0.2, outside the range normally deemed suitable for fitting with JKTEBOP, but it was used in the source article and ebop maven testing was able to achieve a similar fit; all sectors give consistent fits despite the variability and minimal pre-processing;

GW Eri.source: DEBCat and Graczyk et al. (2022) table 9. WD code used for fitting sector 31 (table 8).
GW Eri.details: 2 short cadence sectors (5 & 31); an inclined circuler orbit with partial eclipses of ~0.27 mag; noticable ellipsoidal effect; the stars have similar radii and luminosities;

OO Peg.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 18, Table IV. TESS sector 55 TESS-SPOC/SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 43.
OO Peg.details: just sector 55 and only at 600 s cadence; a circular orbit with clear eclipses of ~0.38 and ~0.35 mag;
OO Peg.notes: not in TESS-ebs so ephemeris & morph defined here; mask out isolated section in S55; Southworth24obsR18 uses E(B-V)=0.09+/-0.02 mag and gives dist=238.8+/-6.1 pc;

CW Eri.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 17, Table VI. TESS sectors 4 and 31 SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 43.
CW Eri.details: 2 short cadence sectors (4 & 31); a slightly eccentric orbit with eclipses of ~0.46 and ~0.40 mag; evidence of ellipsoidal variation;
CW Eri.notes: mask out section of isolated & distorted LC in sector 4; OverallSouthworth24obsR17 uses E(B-V)=0.013+/-0.015 mag and gives dist=191.7+/-3.8 pc;

ZZ Boo.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 12, Table V. TESS sectors 23 & 50 SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 42.
ZZ Boo.details: 2 short cadence sectors (23 & 50); a circular orbit with similar eclipses of ~0.65 mag each; the stars are of similar size and luminosity;
ZZ Boo.notes: tess-ebs period is half the actual value; mask isolated section of S50; Southworth23obsR12 uses E(B-V)=0.00+/-0.01 mag and gives dist=106.5+/-1.4 pc;

RZ Cha.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 23, Table V. TESS sectors 65 & 66 SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 43.
RZ Cha.details: 2 short cadence sectors (65 & 66); a pair of F5 stars in a 2.83 d circular orbit; eclipses are partial with similar depths of ~0.4 mag;
RZ Cha.notes: not in TESS-ebs so ephemeris & morph defined here; Southworth25obsR23 uses E(B-V)=0.05+/-0.02 and gives dist=176.7+/-3.7 pc;

V570 Per.source: Rediscussion 14, Table III. TESS sectors 18 and 58 SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 43.
V570 Per.details: 2 short cadence sectors (18 & 58); an inclined circular orbit with variability due to starspots & evidence of the ellipsoidal effect; shallow eclipses of ~0.11 & ~0.10 mag; the source characterisation used a spectroscopic light ratio to constrain the fit;
V570 Per.notes: unable to get the sector fits to agree - going to limit to S58 which has significantly higher pdc_tot (0.871 vs 0.591); Southworth23obsR14 uses E(B-V)=0.05+/-0.02 mag and gives a dist=117.2+/-2.3 pc;

AN Cam.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 4, Table III.  TESS sectors 19, 25, and 26 (timeseries data from FFI) analysed with JKTEBOP version 41.
AN Cam.details: 5 short cadence sectors (52-53, 59, 73 & 79); a highly eccentric 20.1 d orbit with the secondary eclipse near phase 0.8; eclipse depths of ~0.6 and ~0.5 mag; the primary eclipses are total and the secondary eclipses are partial;
AN Cam.notes: not in TESS-ebs so ephemeris & morph defined here; long period means we ideally want to fit multiple sectors, so we go with S52+53; will likely benefit from flattening; Southworth21obsR4 uses E(B-V)=0.06+/-0.04 and a distance of 311.7+/-1.4 pc based on the Gaia DR3 parallax;

IT Cas.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 13, Table III. TESS sectors 17, 24 and 57 SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 43.
IT Cas.details: 3 short cadence sectors (17, 24 & 57); an eccentric orbit with low inclination; similar eclipse depths of ~0.7 mag; the two components are similar;
IT Cas.notes: maven tests use flattening but we get a good fit with or without; Southworth23obsR13 uses E(B-V)=0.083+/-0.056 mag and gives dist=505.5+/-8.3 pc;

UZ Dra.source: Rediscussion 27, Tables II and V. A total of 41 TESS sectors with 120 s cadence SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 44.
UZ Dra.details: 41 short cadence sectors (14-16, 18-26, 40-41, 47-60, 73-78 & 80-86); a pair of late-F stars in a circular 3.26 d orbit; total primary and secondary eclipses with depths of ~0.70 and ~0.55 mag;
UZ Dra.notes: many sectors available and relatively short period which can all fit pretty well;  selecting individual sectors from each group with highest pdc_tot (& pdc_tot > 0.9); Southworth25obsR27 uses E(B-V)=0.02+/-0.01 and gives dist=185.7+/-2.4 pc;

V455 Aur.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 5, Table III. TESS sector 20 SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 41. TESS sectors 60 and 73 released subsequent to publication.
V455 Aur.details: 3 short cadence sectors (20, 60 & 73); a slightly eccentric, inclined orbit with eclipses of ~0.33 & ~0.30; a third non-eclipsing component in 4200 d orbit;
V455 Aur.notes: Southworth21obsR5 uses E(B-V)=0.002+/-0.002 mag and dist=77.68+/-0.31 pc from the Gaia DR3 parallax;

V505 Per.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 6, Table V. TESS sector 18 SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 41. TESS sector 58 observations released subsequent to publication.
V505 Per.details: 3 short cadence sectors (18, 58 & 85); an inclined circular orbit with eclipses of ~0.5 mag; some phase shift on later sectors;
V505 Per.notes: TESS-ebs period is half actual value; distortion of the light curve near BTJD 1791; for now omitting S58 & 85 as cannot get consistent fit; Southworth21obsR6 uses E(B-V)=0.002+/-0.002 mag and gives dist=61.19+/-0.62 pc;

AI Phe.source: DEBCat and Maxted et al. (2020), Table 4. The Southworth analysis of TESS sector 2 PDCSAP flux (K, JKTEBOP v38, quad LD law).  Teff and subsequently calculated L from Kirkby+Kent et al. (2016) table 8 best fit (alpha_ml=1.78/DeltaY=0.00)
AI Phe.details: 4 short cadence sectors (2, 29, 69 & 96); only S2 has complete instances of both eclipse types; an eccentric orbit with early secondary eclipses; star B is significantly larger and evolved with k~1.6; primary eclipses are total and the secondary eclipses are partial;
AI Phe.notes: not in TESS-ebs so ephemeris & morph defined here; only S2 is usable/has both eclipses; from ebop maven testing it's known that this target has a tendancy to (jktebop) fit incorrectly;

HP Dra.source: Rediscussion 26, Table IV. The 120 s SAP photometry from 14 TESS sectors (14, 15, 26, 40, 41, 53-55, 59, 74, 75, 80, 82, 86) analysed with JKTEBOP.
HP Dra.details: 14 short cadence sectors (14-15, 26, 40-41, 53-55, 59, 74-75, 80, 82 & 86); a pair of late-F stars in a 10.76 d orbit; primary and secondary eclipses of ~0.28 and 0.24 mag; eccentric with slightly late secondary; slow variability in the light curves is likely instrumental in origin;
HP Dra.notes: taking best sector from each group by pdc_tot (treating 0 as 1) & excluding < 0.5; using flattening as morph < 0.2; Southworth25obsR26 uses E(B-V)=0.00+/-0.01 mag and gives dist=77.9+/-1.2 pc;

ZZ UMa.source: DEBCat and Rediscussion 11, Table V. TESS sectors 14, 21, 41, 47 and 48 SAP photometry analysed with JKTEBOP version 42.
ZZ UMa.details: 7 short sectors (14, 21, 41, 47-78 & 74-75); circular orbit with total eclipses of ~0.65 and ~0.35 mag; significant variability due to starspot activity;
ZZ UMa.notes: very sparse field so can fix L3=0; omitting S74 & 75 as poor quality with lower pdc_tot than others; Southworth22obsR11 uses E(B-V)=0.00+/-0.01 mag and gives dist=180.8+/-1.9 pc;

QR Hya.source: DEBCat and Graczyk et al. (2022) table 9. WD code used for fitting TESS sector 9 PDCSAP data (omitted sector 36 due to starspots). Sector 63 released subsequent to publication.
QR Hya.details: 3 short cadence sectors (9, 36 & 63); an inclined orbit with partial eclipses of ~0.30 & ~0.28 mag; startspot activity;
QR Hya.notes: tess-ebs ephemeris has incorrect (half) period; omitting sector 63 for low pdc_tot relative to others; sparse field so replicating maven test by fixing L3=0;

V530 Ori.source: DEBCat and Torres et al. (2014) table 10. JKTEBOP was used to analyse various non-TESS photometry sources.
V530 Ori.details: 1 short cadence sector (33); a G+M pair in an eccentric 6.1 d orbit; partial primary partial eclipses of ~0.5 mag and shallow secondary total eclipses of ~0.06 mag; some variability, potentially from star spots;
V530 Ori.notes: not in TESS-ebs so ephemeris & morph defined here; maven tests used flattening & fixing L3=0 to get control fit; as field is sparse we fix L3=0; keeping flattening for now as otherwise we cannot fit secondary; TorresSandbergLacy+14apj give E(B-V)=0.045+/-0.020 mag and dist=103+/-6 pc;

CM Dra.source: DEBCAT and Martin et al. (2024), Table I. TESS Sectors 16, 19, 22-26, 49-52 (all slow) and 56-59 (200 s) analysed with EXOPLANET. SpT, Teff & logL from Morales et al. (2009). logg values calculated from radii and masses;
CM Dra.details: 25 short cadence sectors (16, 19, 22-26, 49-52, 56-59, 76-80 & 82-86); many sectors at slower cadences; a pair of M-dwarfs in a nearly circular, slightly inclined 1.27 d orbit; eclipses are ~0.76 and ~0.73 mag deep; frequent flares however these appear to have little affect on the fit;
CM Dra.notes: many sectors and short cadence with a good fit possible on most; we pick the subset with highest pdc_tot (>=0.950);
